name: Gibraltar
description: Gibraltar, a British Overseas Territory located at the southern tip of the Iberian Peninsula, is a dramatic and unique landscape characterized by towering limestone cliffs, a rich history, and a fascinating blend of cultures.  It sits astride the Strait of Gibraltar, offering stunning views of both Africa and Europe.  The territory boasts a diverse ecosystem, a strategic military location, and a vibrant tourism industry.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: English is the official language, though Spanish is widely spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Gibraltar's unique status as a British Overseas Territory has resulted in a fascinating linguistic landscape.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Gibraltar is approximately 33,000.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population are of British descent, with a significant Spanish-speaking minority.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The currency used is the British Pound Sterling.
quickFacts.detail: While the UK currency is used, the euro is also accepted in many establishments.

quickFacts.label: Highest Point
quickFacts.description: The highest point in Gibraltar is the Peake of Europa.
quickFacts.detail: This limestone peak offers panoramic views of the surrounding area.

quickFacts.label: Time Zone
quickFacts.detail: During the summer months, Gibraltar switches to British Summer Time (BST).

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The area of Gibraltar is approximately 6.8 square kilometers.
quickFacts.detail: It's a remarkably compact territory with a high population density.

climateData.title: Mediterranean Climate
climateData.description: Gibraltar enjoys a Mediterranean climate characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. The location on the Atlantic coast influences the climate, creating a unique microclimate.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summers are hot and dry, with average temperatures ranging from 28°C to 35°C (82°F to 95°F). Sunshine is abundant, and rainfall is minimal.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a gradual cooling of temperatures and an increase in rainfall. The landscape transforms with vibrant autumnal colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are mild, with average temperatures ranging from 8°C to 15°C (46°F to 59°F). Rainfall is more frequent, and occasional frosts occur.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming of temperatures and blossoming wildflowers. The landscape comes alive with color.

naturalWonders.name: The Upper Rock Nature Reserve
naturalWonders.description: The Upper Rock is a dramatic limestone ridge dominating Gibraltar's skyline. It’s a UNESCO World Heritage Site, showcasing remarkable geological formations and a diverse ecosystem.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The rock is composed of ancient limestone, sculpted by millions of years of erosion. It’s home to numerous caves, including the famous Great Siege Tunnels and the Barbary Macaque monkeys.

naturalWonders.name: St. Michael's Cave
naturalWonders.description: St. Michael’s Cave is a spectacular limestone cave system, renowned for its impressive stalactites and stalagmites, and its historical significance as a refuge during sieges.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The cave was used as a refuge during the Great Siege of Gibraltar in 1783.  Its formations are a testament to the power of water and time.  Light shows and musical performances are regularly held within the cave.
viewingTips: Allow at least 1 hour for a tour.
Photography is permitted in designated areas.

ecosystemData.title: Gibraltar's Unique Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: Gibraltar’s ecosystem is remarkably diverse for its size, encompassing a range of habitats from coastal cliffs and Mediterranean scrubland to limestone caves and a small, sheltered bay.

biodiversityCategories.name: Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: The flora of Gibraltar is adapted to the Mediterranean climate, featuring drought-resistant shrubs, herbs, and wildflowers.

notableSpecies.name: Mediterranean Cushion Rose
notableSpecies.significance: A rare and endemic species found only in Gibraltar.

notableSpecies.name: Gibraltar Rock Violet
notableSpecies.significance: A distinctive violet species adapted to the rocky terrain.

biodiversityCategories.name: Fauna
biodiversityCategories.description: Gibraltar’s fauna includes a variety of bird species, reptiles, and mammals, many of which are migratory.

statistics.details: Over 120 bird species are recorded annually.
Ten reptile species inhabit the territory.

notableSpecies.name: Barbary Macaque
notableSpecies.significance: The only wild population of Barbary Macaques in Europe.

notableSpecies.name: Bonelli's Eagle
notableSpecies.significance: A majestic raptor that nests in the Upper Rock.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Gibraltar
activities.description: Gibraltar offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from challenging hikes to relaxing beach days.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Gibraltar’s dramatic landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Peake of Europa Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the highest point in Gibraltar, offering stunning panoramic views.
safety: Check weather conditions before setting out.

activities.name: Mediterranean Steps Hike
activities.description: A scenic walk along the Mediterranean Steps, offering views of the coastline.
safety: Watch your footing on the steps.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Gibraltar Bay.

activities.name: Swimming
activities.description: Swim in the clear waters of Gibraltar Bay.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, scarf, gloves.

equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, map, compass.
